keyMoments.title: Devil Dias Attempts to Escape Slavery
keyMoments.description: Devil Dias, a former pirate captain enslaved by the Celestial Dragons, runs through Sabaody Archipelago desperately begging people to help him remove his explosive slave collar so he can see his family again.
keyMoments.significance: This tragic scene introduces Devil Dias and demonstrates the brutal reality of slavery under the Celestial Dragons, setting up the moral conflict for Luffy.
keyMoments.quote: Please, somebody help me! I need to get this collar off! My son was just a baby when I left... I just want to see my family one more time!

keyMoments.title: Slave Collar Explodes
keyMoments.description: Unable to remove his collar, Devil Dias attempts to break it off himself. The explosive collar detonates, severely injuring him.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the lethal control system that prevents slaves from escaping the Celestial Dragons.

keyMoments.title: Murdered by Saint Shalria
keyMoments.description: After being gravely wounded by the collar explosion, Devil Dias is callously shot and killed by Saint Shalria, who considers him 'useless.'
keyMoments.significance: His death crystallizes the absolute cruelty of the Celestial Dragons and serves as a catalyst for Luffy's rage.

reveals.information: Had a wife and baby son before becoming a pirate and being enslaved
Was part of Saint Rosward's collection of enslaved pirate captains

keyMoments.title: Saint Rosward's Debut
keyMoments.description: Saint Rosward arrives in Sabaody Archipelago riding on the back of a slave. He wears the distinctive bubble helmet of the World Nobles and is accompanied by his daughter Shalria and an entourage of slaves.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the primary Celestial Dragon antagonists of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and establishes the extreme class inequality in the One Piece world.

relationships.description: Saint Shalria is Saint Rosward's daughter

evolutionMoments.description: Revealed as father and daughter when they arrive together at Sabaody

reveals.information: Member of the World Nobles/Celestial Dragons, the descendants of the World Government's founders
Owns a collection of enslaved pirate captains including Jean Bart

keyMoments.title: Saint Shalria's Debut
keyMoments.description: Saint Shalria arrives in Sabaody Archipelago with her father Saint Rosward, riding on the back of a slave. She wears the distinctive bubble helmet and displays the arrogance typical of World Nobles.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a key Celestial Dragon antagonist who will demonstrate the cruelty and inhumanity of the World Nobles.

keyMoments.title: Saint Shalria Murders Devil Dias
keyMoments.description: Saint Shalria callously shoots the wounded Devil Dias with a pistol, treating the act of murder as casually as discarding trash, simply because he is 'useless' and 'unsightly.'
keyMoments.significance: This brutal act establishes Saint Shalria as utterly devoid of empathy and crystallizes the moral bankruptcy of the Celestial Dragons. It serves as a major catalyst for Luffy's rage.
keyMoments.quote: How unsightly. This slave is completely useless now.

relationships.description: Saint Shalria is Saint Rosward's daughter

evolutionMoments.description: Revealed as father and daughter when they arrive together at Sabaody

reveals.information: Completely devoid of empathy, treats human life as worthless and murder as casual
Member of the World Nobles/Celestial Dragons

keyMoments.title: Jean Bart Appears as a Slave
keyMoments.description: Jean Bart is introduced as one of Saint Rosward's slaves, part of his collection of captured pirate captains. He is a large, imposing man forced to carry the World Noble on his back.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Jean Bart's character and demonstrates that even powerful pirates can fall victim to the slave trade. Sets up his eventual liberation by Trafalgar Law.

relationships.description: Jean Bart is enslaved by Saint Rosward as part of his pirate captain collection

evolutionMoments.description: Jean Bart is shown as one of Saint Rosward's slaves

reveals.information: Was a pirate captain before being captured and enslaved by the Celestial Dragons
Extraordinarily large man, surpassing Jinbe's size by two to three times
